text: Oh sure, the plot was totally groundbreaking… not.
I just love it when characters make the most obvious decisions ever.
Yeah, I totally needed another 2-hour montage of people staring at walls.
Absolutely loved the ending—if confusion is what you were going for.
Wow, the soundtrack really enhanced that totally forgettable scene.
I really appreciated the deep philosophical dialogue between two cardboard cutouts.
Oh, the twists were so shocking, I didn’t see the obvious coming… at all.
I adore a good villain who literally explains their entire plan in one sentence.
Sure, the cinematography was stunning… if you like watching paint dry.
Loved every second of that incredibly fast-paced slow-motion chase.
I couldn’t stop laughing at how seriously they took that totally unfunny joke.
Yes, let’s have a 10-minute monologue about absolutely nothing important.
The characters’ chemistry was explosive… if by explosive you mean non-existent.
Oh yeah, nothing says emotional depth like staring blankly into the horizon for 5 minutes.
I loved the suspense, especially the part where literally nothing happened.
The plot development was so subtle, I didn’t even notice it exist.
The dialogue really made me feel something… mostly my regret.
Oh, fantastic! Another sequel that completely ignores the original story.
The special effects were mind-blowing… for a 1998 video game.
I loved how the soundtrack was practically nonexistent; so innovative!
Of course, the main character’s journey was unpredictable… if you’ve never seen a movie before.
Yeah, I’m so inspired by that totally original, definitely not recycled, plotline.
I just adore watching 2 hours of people walking around aimlessly.
The pacing was exhilarating, especially during the parts where nothing happened.
I felt so connected to the story… connected to my desire to nap.
The humor was subtle… if subtle means completely nonexistent.
Absolutely loved the way the movie resolved every single plot hole with silence.
I was so moved by the dialogue, mostly because I was laughing at how bad it was.
Wow, what a masterpiece… in the sense that I can’t believe they made it.
Oh yes, I definitely needed another inspirational speech about nothing.
The plot twists were shocking… if being obvious counts as shocking.
I really appreciated the subtle nuances… mostly the ones that didn’t exist.
Loved the character development, especially the parts where none existed.
Yeah, let’s give the villain a long, unnecessary backstory that changes nothing.
I was on the edge of my seat during the incredibly dull fight scene.
Absolutely amazing how the story stayed so consistently boring.
Oh, the romantic subplot was so moving… if only I cared about the characters.
The ending tied everything together… mostly my headache from watching it.
I felt so much suspense, especially when the characters didn’t do anything.
Loved the clever symbolism, like the completely random background objects.
Yes, the dialogue was so natural… if by natural you mean completely forced.
The villain was terrifying… if by terrifying you mean boring and dull.
I was so inspired by the story… inspired to check my phone.
Oh yes, I adore a plot that moves so slowly I forget what’s happening.
The special effects were breathtaking… in a completely accidental way.
I loved the emotional depth, especially when there wasn’t any.
The story had subtle twists… subtle as a brick to the face.
I really connected with the protagonist… mostly because I was laughing at them.
Oh, the suspense was intense… if ignoring everything counts as suspense.
I loved the romantic tension… so much tension that I fell asleep.
The plot was so gripping… I couldn’t stop staring at my ceiling.
Yeah, I definitely needed another 5 minutes of exposition I already knew.
I was totally engaged by the story… engaged in my daydreams.
The dialogue was witty… if by witty you mean completely nonsensical.
I loved the cinematic techniques, especially when they made no sense.
The emotional scenes really hit… mostly my patience.
Oh yes, the plot was so original… not in any possible way.
I was totally invested in the characters… invested in leaving early.
The action scenes were thrilling… thrillingly boring.
The humor was clever… clever like a soggy pancake.
I loved the suspense… suspenseful enough to glance at my watch.
The story was emotionally deep… as deep as a puddle.
I adored the character arcs… arcs that literally went nowhere.
The pacing was perfect… perfectly tedious.
The ending was satisfying… satisfied in the sense that it was finally over.
I really enjoyed the symbolism… symbolic of nothing at all.
The plot twists were clever… cleverly obvious.
I was touched by the story… touched in the sense that I blinked.
The dialogue was natural… naturally cringeworthy.
I loved every character’s journey… mostly their terrible choices.
The story kept me guessing… guessing why I watched it.
Oh, the suspense was intense… intensely boring.
I really connected to the themes… connected in a way that was completely meaningless.
The cinematography was breathtaking… breathtakingly uninspired.
The emotional moments were so moving… moving me to roll my eyes.
The dialogue was clever… cleverly cringey.
I loved the pacing… paced like a snail on vacation.
The ending wrapped up everything beautifully… beautifully enough to forget it immediately.
